adjective.description: Of or relating to Porphyry or to his doctrines.

noun.description: A disciple or follower of Porphyry.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in The Holie Bible, conteynyng the Olde Testament and the Newe. From post-classical Latin Porphyrianus from Porphyrius, the name of Porphyry, Neo-Platonic philosopher and opponent of Christianity + classical Latin -ānus. With use as noun compare French Porphyrien and earlier Porphyrianist.
